title: Post-election period now in effect: Police
byline: The post-election period will last for one week starting from the date that the general election results are declared, the police said.

title: Three-day workshop for newly elected members
byline: It has been decided to hold a three-day workshop regarding the parliamentary system for the newly elected members of the 10th Parliament.

title: Israel warfare methods ’consistent with genocide’: UN committee
byline: Israel’s war conduct in Gaza “is consistent with the characteristics of genocide,” including mass civilian casualties and using starvation as a weapon, according to a new United Nations Special Committee report released Thursday.

title: Karoline Leavitt to become youngest White House press secretary
byline: Donald Trump has announced that he will tap Karoline Leavitt, his campaign spokeswoman, to serve as White House press secretary in his next administration.

title: Heavy rains after 2 pm today, watch out for lightning
byline: Thundershowers will occur in most parts of the country after 2 p.m today and it may cause damages due to temporary localised strong winds and lightning during thundershowers.

title: SJB should undergo changes, appoint right people: Ajith P. Perera
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) should undergo changes to face the challenges of new politics and of the new world, it’s newly elected MP Ajith P. Perera said today.

title: People have done justice to women by voting more of them into Parliament: NPP MP-elect
byline: Voters in Sri Lanka have respected and approved the ideology of increasing women reparasetation in elected bodies, NPP MP elect Nilanthi Kottahachchi said, a day after the National Preople’s Power (NPP) swept the Parliamentary elections.

title: SLPP nominates Namal as National List MP
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has announced its decision to nominate Namal Rajapaksa as a Member of Parliament through the party’s National List.

title: Canadian Tamil Congress congratulates AKD on electoral victory, asks for new constitution
byline: The Canadian Tamil Congress (CTC) has sent an official letter to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and  the National People’s Power (NPP), congratulating them on their resounding and historic victory in the recent parliamentary elections.

title: Over 5% votes rejected at 2024 General Elections
byline: The Election Commission reports that 5.65% of the votes cast were rejected at the 2024 General Elections.

title: Russia’s Red Wings airline brings 100,000 tourists
byline: Russia’s Red Wings airline has brought around 100,000 tourists to Sri Lanka, generating an income of US $ 165 million ,  according to former Sri Lankan Ambassador to Russia Udayanga Weetatunga.

title: Rehan Jayawickreme to quit politics after election loss
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Weligama Organiser Rehan Jayawickreme said he will step back from active politics and will resign as the SJB Weligama Organiser.

title: Bus operations to return people to Colombo start from today
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) announced that their bus services will be operated from today (16) for the people to return to Colombo.

title: 10 newborns killed in hospital fire
byline: t least 16 children are battling for their lives while 10 newborns died as a fire broke out last night at a hospital in Uttar Pradesh’s Jhansi.

title: President to present government’s Policy Statement on November 21
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will present the new government’s Policy Statement at the ceremonial sitting during the first session of the 10th Parliament on November 21, the Department of Communication of Parliament said today.

title: Paul beats Tyson, 58, on points in drab contest
byline: Youtuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul left a permanent stain on two-time heavyweight champion Mike Tyson’s boxing legacy with a tedious points win in front of 70,000 frustrated fans in Texas - and millions watching the controversial bout on streaming powerhouse Netflix.

title: USS destroyer arrives in Colombo
byline: USS Michael Murphy of the United States Navy arrived at the port of Colombo on a replenishment visit today. The Sri Lanka Navy welcomed the visiting ship in compliance with naval traditions.

title: Election Commission clarifies National List MP eligibility
byline: The Election Commission has clarified the criteria for appointing Members of Parliament (MPs) through the National List.

title: CC approves Justice Murdu Fernando as Chief Justice
byline: The Constitutional Council has approved the recommendation to appoint Justice Murdu Fernando as Chief Justice.

title: Mahindananda Aluthgamage retires from active politics
byline: Former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage announced his retirement from active politics this morning (16).
